intro: Sida krapovickasii, commonly known as the African mallow, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, pink or white flowers. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other mallows and cotton plants. Sida krapovickasii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
